data.title: Lacey Chabert Shifts From Hallmark to Netflix for Holiday Rom-Com
data.meta_description: Lacey Chabert is set to appear in the upcoming Netflix holiday rom-com ‚ÄòHot Frosty‚Äô alongside Dustin Milligan, Chrishell Stause and more
data.text:
Hallmark queen Lacey Chabert is expanding her holiday movie repertoire with her upcoming Netflix film.

Chabert, 41, is slated to star in the Christmas rom-com Hot Frosty, which joins the streaming service‚Äôs 2024 holiday slate alongside Lindsay Lohan‚Äôs Our Little Secret and Christina Milian‚Äôs Meet Me Next Christmas. The movie will follow Chabert as Cathy, a widow who brings a snowman to life two years after losing her husband.

‚ÄúThrough his na√Øvet√©, the snowman helps Cathy to laugh, feel and love again, as the two fall for each other just in time for the holidays ‚Ä¶ and before he melts,‚Äù the official logline reads.

In addition to Chabert, Dustin Milligan, Chrishell Stause, Joe Lo Truglio, Craig Robinson, Katy Mixon and Lauren Holly also star. Jerry Ciccoritti will direct with a script penned by Russell Hainline.

‚ÄúSo excited to share the news!,‚Äù Chabert captioned the announcement via Instagram on Monday, May 13. ‚ÄúWorking alongside this incredible cast, director, and producers has been a joyful experience. ‚òÉÔ∏èüéÑ.‚Äù

Chabert‚Äôs costar Strause, 42, quickly took to the comments section to gush over getting to film with the actress. ‚ÄúYou are the sweetest-Hope to work again together in the future ü•∞.‚Äù she wrote, to which Chabert, replied, ‚ÄúIt was so lovely to meet you and work together! üíú.‚Äù

Chabert‚Äôs jump to Netflix doesn‚Äôt mean she‚Äôs abandoning her Hallmark home, where she has already starred in more than 25 films. This year, she‚Äôll appear in The Christmas Quest alongside Kristoffer Polaha for the network‚Äôs holiday rollout and in the unscripted series Celebrations with Lacey Chabert, in which she and her team plan a surprise party to give back to folks who make an impact on their communities.

Chabert will also serve as an executive producer on the project, which is set to air 10 episodes on Hallmark‚Äôs streaming service, Hallmark Movies Now, in late 2024.

‚ÄúThese movies mean so much to me. I really am genuine when I say that,‚Äù Chabert exclusively told Us Weekly in October 2021 of her longtime partnership with Hallmark ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre not just jobs, and I feel a responsibility to the audience to make the absolute best movie I can.‚Äù

The actress noted that she tries to ‚Äúraise the bar‚Äù on each project to keep fans coming back for more, adding, ‚Äú[When] someone lets you into their living room for two hours, it‚Äôs kind of an honor. I want to leave people with a good feeling.‚Äù

While Chabert has been known for her more wholesome roles in recent years, she has starred in various edgier comedies, including 2004‚Äôs Mean Girls as Gretchen Weiner. She recently reunited with her Mean Girls costars Lohan, 37, and Amanda Seyfried last year for a nostalgia-inspired Walmart ad. The trio reprised their characters for the store‚Äôs Black Friday deals.

‚ÄúIt was wonderful to spend the day with Amanda and Lindsay,‚Äù Chabert said in a statement at the time. ‚ÄúIt was so much fun to reminisce and be together again after all these years.‚Äù
